intro: Myrsine vescoi, commonly known as the New Zealand myrsine, is a small evergreen shrub native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. It produces small, white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. Myrsine vescoi is often found in coastal and lowland forests, thriving in moist, shaded environments.
